snippet.title: Elon Musk REVEALED The SHOCKING TRUTH About Bill Gates!
snippet.description:
Elon Musk, SpaceX and Tesla

Last year during the pandemic Elon Musk doubled down on Covid-19 skepticism and said that he won't take future vaccines. Musk even called the pandemic quarantine facist.
In an interview on CNBC's "Squawk Box," Gates criticized Musk's controversial comments on the virus and implied that Musk shouldn't be speaking about the pandemic at all. He said,
“Elon’s positioning is to maintain a high level of outrageous comments,” Gates said. “He’s not much involved in vaccines. He makes a great electric car. And his rockets work well. So he’s allowed to say these things. I hope that he doesn’t confuse areas he’s not involved in too much.”
Musk, the South African born billionaire was enraged by Gates' remarks and mocked him on Twitter. He jokingly posted multiple tweets about Gates, including “Billy G is not my lover” and “the rumour that Bill Gates & I are lovers is completely untrue.”
Musk defended himself against Gates’ comments, saying he’d spent time with Harvard University epidemiologists “doing antibody studies” and noting Tesla’s work with CureVac.
Later in an interview with  journalist Kara Swisher Musk said bluntly that "Gates said something about me not knowing what I was doing. It's like, hey, knucklehead, we actually make the vaccine machines for CureVac, that company you're invested in."
Elon Musk, however, is involved in fighting the coronavirus. The billionaire redirected Tesla resources to source and produce ventilators. He also teamed up with the German biotech firm CureVac to make a device to aid in vaccine production. Bill Gates, on the other hand, who is also a known philanthropist, is also the investor in CureVac and pledged US$100 million to fight the virus via the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.
Musk has frequently downplayed the severity of the virus and strongly criticised stay-at-home orders. He promoted the malaria drug hydroxychloroquine as a treatment for the virus, falsely said that children are immune to it, and questioned data regarding coronavirus deaths.
